org.eng.aisp.dataset

Class MetaDataZip

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.eng.aisp.util.FileZipper
      • org.eng.aisp.dataset.MetaDataZip

  • public class MetaDataZip
extends FileZipper
    Provides a way to write one or more sounds with and metadata file into a ZIP stream. Start and end times are preserved.
    Author:
    dawood

    • Method Detail

      • readSoundRecordings

        public static IShuffleIterable<SoundRecording> readSoundRecordings(InputStream zippedSounds)
                                                            throws IOException
        A convenience on readNamedSounds(InputStream). Read a zip stream containing wav files and optionally a metadata.csv file. If no metadata.csv is provided, then 1) sounds will not have any labels and 2) the start times make the sounds consecutive in time from the time the first sound is read. Restore start times in from the hidden label #START_TIME_MSEC_LABEL if present.
        Parameters:
        zippedSounds - stream of zipped bytes containing wav files and a metdata file.
        Returns:
        the recordings represented in the stream zipped bytes provided.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • readSegmentedSounds

        public static IShuffleIterable<SegmentedSoundRecording> readSegmentedSounds(InputStream zippedSounds)
                                                                     throws IOException
        A convenience on readNamedSounds(InputStream). Read a zip stream containing wav files and optionally a metadata.csv file. If no metadata.csv is provided, then 1) sounds will not have any labels and 2) the start times make the sounds consecutive in time from the time the first sound is read. Restore start times in from the hidden label #START_TIME_MSEC_LABEL if present.
        Parameters:
        zippedSounds - stream of zipped bytes containing wav files and a metdata file.
        Returns:
        the recordings represented in the stream zipped bytes provided.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • readNamedSounds

        public static IShuffleIterable<MetaDataZip.NamedSound> readNamedSounds(InputStream zippedSounds)
                                                                throws IOException
        Read a zip stream containing wav files and optionally a metadata.csv file. If no metadata.csv is provided, then 1) sounds will not have any labels and 2) the start times will all be the time the first sound file is read. If there is a metadata.csv and the tags or labels contain the hidden label #START_TIME_MSEC_LABEL, then the start times will be set from it. This is added during write(OutputStream, Iterable, String).
        Parameters:
        is - stream of zipped bytes containing wav files and a metdata file.
        Returns:
        a list of the recordings represented in the stream zipped bytes together with their names in the order they appear in the zip stream.
        Throws:
        IOException - if zip does not contain metadata.csv.

      • write

        public static void write(OutputStream os,
                         Iterable<SoundRecording> sounds,
                         String baseName)
                  throws IOException
        Write the zip bytes representing the given recordings to the given stream using add(String, SoundRecording). Preserve start times in a hidden label #START_TIME_MSEC_LABEL.
        Parameters:
        os - stream to write zip bytes. closed during finalizeZip() which must be called to complete/flush the zip stream.
        sounds - sounds to write to stream
        baseName - base namem to which the 0-based index of the sound will be appended. May be null.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • writeSegmentedSounds

        public static void writeSegmentedSounds(OutputStream os,
                                        Iterable<SegmentedSoundRecording> sounds,
                                        String baseName)
                                 throws IOException
        Write the zip bytes representing the given recordings to the given stream using add(String, SoundRecording). Preserve start times in a hidden label #START_TIME_MSEC_LABEL.
        Parameters:
        os - stream to write zip bytes. closed during finalizeZip() which must be called to complete/flush the zip stream.
        sounds - sounds to write to stream
        baseName - base namem to which the 0-based index of the sound will be appended. May be null.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • add

        public void add(String fileName,
                SoundRecording sr)
         throws IOException
        Append the given recording and assign it the given name in the zip stream. The recording and its labels are appended to the instance's MetaData object and the start time of the clip is included as a hidden label with the name #START_TIME_MSEC_LABEL.
        Parameters:
        fileName - a unique name as it should appear in the zip file. If not unique, then an exception is thrown. If this includes a path, the path will be stripped. If it does not have the ".wav" extension, it will be added.
        sr -
        Throws:
        IOException

      • add

        public void add(String fileName,
                SegmentedSoundRecording ssr)
         throws IOException
        Append the given segmented recording and its segments and assign it the given name in the zip stream. The recording and its labels are appended to the instance's MetaData object and the start time of the clip is included as a hidden label with the name #START_TIME_MSEC_LABEL.
        Parameters:
        fileName - a unique name as it should appear in the zip file. If not unique, then an exception is thrown. If this includes a path, the path will be stripped. If it does not have the ".wav" extension, it will be added.
        sr -
        Throws:
        IOException
